subject: Public Speaking
title: Frederick Douglass Speaks for Freedom
description: One-minute skill: Frederick Douglass Speaks for Freedom.

hook.text: Frederick Douglass escaped slavery and became one of the most powerful speakers in American history.

buildup.text: Abolitionist groups invited him to speak, expecting simple testimony. Instead he delivered masterful rhetoric.

discovery.text: His 1852 speech asked: What to the slave is the Fourth of July? The audience sat in stunned silence.

twist.text: Critics claimed an ex-slave couldn't be that eloquent. His brilliance was used against his credibility.

climax.text: Douglass proved that the most powerful speeches come from lived experience, not just education or privilege.

quiz.question: What made Frederick Douglass's oratory so impactful?
options: His lived experience combined with masterful rhetoric
